programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: There are wobbles for a scuba diving business in Greece when jellyfish hit the shores. In Italy, two novice wine makers hopes of a winter harvest begin to wither on the vine.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Ministers Chris and Caroline need some divine intervention with their home in Alnwick. Chris is ready for a change of scenery and a bigger, more user-friendly space, while Caroline loves their home, and particularly their neighbours.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joanne and former bodybuilding champion Darren hope to find the perfect holiday home on Spains eastern Costa del Sol. Can Jean Johansson find a strong enough contender for their £180k?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mary and Ian dream of owning a holiday home in Portugal and have their hearts set on the glistening Silver Coast. Will a mind-blowing bungalow impress them enough to part with their £215k?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Eastbourne, the first to host is 27-year-old trainee teacher Kirsty Davenport. Will opting to keep her food simple prove a wise move?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its Ann-Marie Hamiltons turn to host on day two in Eastbourne, and she plans to reveal her fun side by singing in her garden. Resident joker Russell Turnbull cant help throwing in some funnies, but serious foodie Adam Holt isnt amused.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its day three in Eastbourne and hairdresser Becci Moloneys outdoor bar is a hit with Kirsty and Ann-Marie. However, Russell and Adam dont know what to make of Beccis collection of recycled toilets in the garden.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Food aficionado Adam Holt takes his turn at hosting on day four in Eastbourne, and expectations are high. However, some of his guests are surprised by a menu that doesnt amount to much more than posh bangers and mash.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its time for funny man Russell Turnbull to take his turn as host for the final night in Eastbourne. Russells played his cards close to his chest all week concerning his culinary skills and some of his rivals are more than intrigued.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nick hosts the weeks third visit at Impossible Motel in the centre of York, where he offers a range of quirky rooms including `rock star suites complete with hot tubs and an eyebrow-raising dungeon room with a bed on chains.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Rachael and Tim cant agree on whether to stay in their 1930s semi, or move somewhere more rural to bring up their two young children. Rachael longs for leafier pastures, but Tim would rather stay closer to his nearby friends and family.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.desc: Bernard and Cosgrove must sift through fact and fiction to find the killer of a young Manhattan socialite; the murder trial takes a turn that becomes personal for Price and puts Maroun in a compromising situation.

programme.desc: The murder of an off-duty NYPD detective threatens to tear the city apart; Cosgrove mourns the loss of a friend and asks Capt. Benson for help solving the case; McCoy and Price disagree on how to prosecute the culprit.

programme.desc: When a graduate student is found dead, Cosgrove and Shaw follow the evidence to a suspect with no clear motive; Price and Maroun uncover a money-grabbing scheme within a church; McCoy warns them to focus on the suspects and not the institution.

programme.title: Law and Order
programme.desc: After shots are fired in a popular nightclub, Cosgrove and Shaw suspect the spree was a ruse to target a sole victim; when security footage mysteriously disappears, Price and Maroun must rely on a witness who values reputation over facts.

programme.desc: The NCIS team consults with three cyber-terrorists they imprisoned after a city-wide Internet shutdown the week before Christmas. Also, McGee reflects on the case and Gibbs infamous rules as he pens a heartfelt letter to his father.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team must investigate a series of crime scenes that appear to be copy-cats of previous cases. Also, two of Gibbs ex-wives, one of which the team has yet to meet, show up at a crime scene to discuss something important with him.

programme.desc: A mass murderer abducts Garcia and Reid, forcing the rest of the team to find them. The BAU examines their past to try and figure out why the pair have been targeted.

programme.desc: Carisi tries Richard Wheatley for the murder of Kathy Stabler; Benson finds herself at odds with a friend when Barba agrees to take the case.

programme.desc: The SVU is called in to help investigate a wave of hate crimes on Christmas Eve; Rollins catches up with an old flame.

programme.desc: Rollins must revisit an old case when a child sent to juvenile detention is released after his 18th birthday.

programme.desc: While Finch still keeps Root hostage, he who cant understand why the Machine is in contact with her, he is the first to make contact with their latest number, that of hypnotherapist Hayden Price.

programme.desc: When a Marine photographer disappears prior to providing testimony to an army court-martial hearing, the NCIS team investigates both the murder he witnessed and a current project centred on military veterans who are homeless in the DC area.

programme.desc: Director Vance gives DiNozzo a special assignment to bring home an Admirals daughter from Paris, but he must turn to his NCIS team for help after he enters a controversial crime scene.

programme.desc: A girl is shot and Cosgrove teams with Det. Jalen Shaw to track down her killer; Benson and Stabler assist and realise its more than a typical homicide; McCoy and Price seek justice against an international crime ring; part 3 of 3.

programme.desc: When a young woman dies a slow and painful death from an untreated infection, Cosgrove and Shaw suspect she was under the influence of a powerful cult; Price and Maroun put pressure on its members to find the cults true mastermind.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team searches for a home-grown terrorist after a rescue mission in Syria reveals an American was involved in the capture of a social worker. Meanwhile, McGee and Bishop question DiNozzos unusual behaviour.

programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate when a Navy lieutenant who is set to be the first openly gay service member to receive the Medal of Honour is murdered. Also, as his wifes due date approaches, Palmer prepares for fatherhood with a NCIS baby shower.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo returns to the military academy he attended as a teenager after a murdered Marine and alumni of the school is found clutching a photo of a current student. Also, Bishop and her husband invite Gibbs and the team out for a special dinner.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A case turns personal when Danny works to protect a nurse from her violent ex-boyfriend. An acquaintance of Franks comes forth with a theory regarding the death of an inmate.

programme.title: Law and Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A boy disappears after meeting up with an online gamer; Benson suspects her son is being bullied.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah takes his series on the building of Britain to his home turf - Lancashire - so he can wax lyrical over the roots of the nations canal network. He visits Worsley to see where it all began and, in his own back garden, and demonstrates the early canal-building process. Fred then takes a trip on the Leeds-Liverpool waterway, revealing the hard work and skill that made such a passage possible.

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel: Life on the Inside
Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Archaeologist Richard Miles presents a series charting the history of the breakthroughs and watersheds in our long quest to understand our ancient past. He begins by going back 2,000 years to explore how archaeology began by trying to prove a biblical truth - a quest that soon got archaeologists into dangerous water.

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: Mrs Thatcher plunged into dramatic conflicts that defined her premiership and her legacy. Against a backdrop of economic downturn Mrs Thatcher struggled in the opinion polls and was labelled the `least popular Prime Minister since polling began but her public image was be transformed by a totally unexpected turn of events in the South Atlantic.

programme.title: The Falklands Play
programme.desc: Dramatic account of the political events leading up to, and including, the 1982 Falklands War.

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Three, two, one, lift off! This edition launches into the extraordinary - and extraterrestrial - world of astronaut training, discovering what it truly takes to become a European Space Agency (ESA) astronaut. As Europe looks to play a more prominent role in space exploration, we shine a spotlight on the candidates who are pushing boundaries and preparing to represent Great Britain and Northern Ireland amongst the stars.

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.desc: Stephen Smith, explores Renaissance Florence under the reign of Grand Duke Cosimo Medici. Cosimos fledgling court prized the finer things in life and some of the greatest painters, sculptors and craftsmen in world history came to serve the Grand Duke. However, successful courtiers had to have brains as well as brawn. The canniest of them looked to theorists like Niccolo Machiavelli for underhand ways to get ahead, whilst enlightened polymaths turned their minds to the heavens, and to ice cream.

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Thirty years ago, Janet Brown was bludgeoned to death. Now her children are making a heartfelt appeal to find her killer. And how Police in Wales caught an ever-dangerous paedophile.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel and Tommy oversee some fantastic renovations on auction buys in Carlisle, Rosyth and Shepherds Bush.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: On todays show, Danny takes a tour of Sheffield Botanical Gardens, where trustee Jill Sinclair shows him some of the 5,000 species of plants and trees that inhabit this urban oasis. Created in the early 19th century, the gardens were once home to a captive bear and monkeys! In more recent times, they fell into disrepair before being restored in 2007. Up the road in Wetherby, two teams gallop around the racecourse in search of bargains to sell at auction.

programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: In Felixstowe, intelligence officer Adam finds a stolen car wedged into the back of a shipping container. On the back seat, there are childrens toys, including a teddy bear.

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The team battle the elements during a dive for precious graduation pictures lost by a newly qualified doctor. Meanwhile, our crafter Jen is challenged to give an entirely new lease of life to discarded tents and camping chairs. Also, a valuable discovery is taken on by our social media detective Mui, who creates an innovative online campaign to track down the owner.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Now back in the UK, a young couple crave the outdoors lifestyle they experienced together for nearly three years in New Zealand. Nicki Chapmans helps them find a new home in the fabulous countryside of North Yorkshire, where they want to spend their spare time running, cycling and walking.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A blind photographers cosy and comforting boots are restored back to their former glory, and a school clock gifted by Florence Nightingale is revived, including a full facelift.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the brainy quiz where the contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ravi steps up for his family, Nigel accidentally offends, and Elaine gives Johnny food for thought.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team revive a working model of a Welsh coal mine, original plans for a British engineering classic and a Victorian writing box owned by a trailblazing female journalist.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: With the first banishment sending shockwaves throughout the castle, the Traitors dont wait long to commit their next murder. As a new day dawns, the celebrity players turn their focus to a mission that forces them to work very closely as a team under punishing conditions. But as night falls, will their teamwork continue in the Round Table and result in catching a Traitor, or will they inadvertently banish a fellow Faithful?

programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit on `Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows it is his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. If the day goes well, it could catapult his career, but if it goes badly, it is game over.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena must ask Simon for a favour, but at a price. With his dream within reach, Kwabena has big choices to make.

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul makes the trip across the pond in search of the queen with the most charisma, uniqueness, nerve and talent in the United Kingdom, setting the contestants a series of challenges week by week.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Take a seat as Natasha learns about a pioneering furniture designer. The teams arent lounging about, however, as they hunt for bargains with Kate Bliss and Danny Sebastian in Ardingly.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The tables are turned for DJ duo Nihal Arthanayake and Dev Griffin as they swap beats for bargains on a trip around the southeast in a jazzy Jaguar XK8.

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Marios Costi is joined by deaf audiologist Sarah Adedeji. They highlight personal stories and creative approaches to support and healing.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and sidekick Sarah Greene host the quiz show where contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor. Correct answers get the players moving, while wrong answers will stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the quiz show where players face a question and pick from a board of six rankable answers. Some answers are good, but only one is unbeatable.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the final banquet, where the ultimate winner will be voted for by Olympians and Paralympians past and present and esteemed sporting guests at the British ambassadors residence in Paris.

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: Off the coast of Yorkshire, Siwrengale is heading out for the beginning of the North Sea whelk season. Skipper Darren Warters is on the hunt with sons Regan and Lewis. Asian demand has created a lucrative fishery in this small patch of the North Sea, but winter storms have badly damaged their pots. Miles of rope must be untangled before they can begin fishing in earnest. South east of Shetland is Long Hole - the deepest waters in the North Sea.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Members of the public bring their antiques to be viewed and valued.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Una Healy, Joanna Page, Jack P Shepherd and Emmanuel Sonubi test their general knowledge skills on this weeks House of Games.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Janette Manrara returns with some training room exclusives, taking a look at how some of the celebs are getting on with their next dances for the very first time this week. And more couples pop by for a chat to reveal some dance secrets.

programme.title: Nigella: At My Table
programme.desc: Featuring some of Nigellas go to favourites, including fried bread and tomato hash, rambunctiously vibrant butternut and sweet potato curry, and her coriander and jalapeño salsa.

programme.title: Jules and Gregs Wild Swim
programme.desc: Jules and Greg take on the Uists - bodysurfing the wild North Atlantic, hitching a ride from the crew after their van breaks down and topping it all off with some island-made gin from a local distillery.

programme.title: Tropic of Cancer
programme.desc: The second leg of the journey sees Simon dodge the Moroccan secret police in Western Sahara, travel on one of the worlds longest trains in Mauritania, visit a forgotten refugee camp in the Algerian desert where more than 100,000 people live, and take a swim in a Libyan oasis with a government minder who bears an uncanny resemblance to Colonel Gadaffi.

programme.title: Fake or Fortune?
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and Philip Mould investigate a charming little white flower picture, purported to be by one of the most important abstract artists of the 20th century, Piet Mondrian. Its owner, American Jeffrey Kroll inherited the picture from his mother and believes it to be genuine. However, the painting was turned down by the authentication committee, so the team will have to find new evidence to help persuade them to change their mind.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: A pride of lions has rewritten the rules - they have learnt to take down elephants.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by murdered and banished Players for exclusive chat. Also, Faithful Maddy and Traitor Freddie join for gameplay analysis and need-to-know Traitors intel.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the days top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBCs range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Spain
programme.desc: In vibrant Madrid, Eva Longoria experiences a city that never stops moving; its rich mix of cultures creates an exhilarating cuisine that excites the senses.

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Marios Costi is joined by deaf audiologist Sarah Adedeji. They highlight personal stories and creative approaches to support and healing.

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: This Could Go Really Well or Really Badly
programme.desc: While Stacey and her green-fingered sidekick Sam wrestle with the ever-growing vegetable patch, Joe ropes in Rex, Rose and Belle to help create the perfect Mothers Day picnic. Meanwhile, older brothers Zach and Leighton take on dinner duty.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the ultimate reality game of detection, treachery and trust continues, the celebrity Players realise that the mission is not only high stakes, but could also hold important information in their hunt for the Traitors. With the sun setting, the first Round Table commences, and emotions run high as the players suspicions are put to the test, but are they looking at the right people?

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by banished and murdered celebrity players to discuss their time on the show - and to reveal the identity of the Traitors for the very first time...

programme.title: Global Eye
programme.desc: Bringing forensic journalism from all corners of the world by BBC Eye, the World Services critically acclaimed investigative unit, and featuring expert global correspondents getting to the heart of the biggest international stories.

programme.title: This is CBBC!
programme.desc: Join the CBBC crew for all your favourite programmes. Tune into CBBC every day from 7.00am.

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The farmer wants to turn the tree in Shauns field into firewood. So the flock must take desperate measures to stop their beloved tree getting the chop.

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: The Baron and Penfold are stranded together on King Kong Brunels desert island. In the skies above the island, the Mark IV and the Frogs Head Flyer are in a race to snatch Brunels All Encompassing Remote Control.

programme.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
programme.desc: When a witch struggles to master her new wand, Twinkle decides to have a go, only to make her friends vanish. She must solo quest to find them.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The gang is ready to celebrate Narwhal Day, one of their favorite holidays. However, they then discover that it isnt a real holiday, just something Dad made up.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Chased by a raging elephant, Grizzy and the Lemmings are ejected from the cabin and land on a small nearby promontory, where one of the rodents is mistaken for being the savannah animals king.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Four Lemming percussionists performing near the booth wake up Grizzy. Grizzy has something to think about.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Plankton hasnt tried to steal the secret formula in a while...and thats making Mr. Krabs nervous!

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Ozzie is torn between helping his replacement on her first day manning the Odd Squad Department of Help desk, and an important mission with Orli and Onom.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Two aspiring warrior-heroes and a lively ghost girl refine the skills they need to take the place of an ageing monster-slayer by completing his odd, supernatural chores.

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: With Joy having been let down by the builders, Danny and Mick step up and offer to build the leisure centres new sauna themselves. But can they follow flat-pack instructions? And will their antics get Joy hot and bothered?

programme.title: Bitesize: 5-7 Year Olds
programme.desc: Using alliteration, using our senses to describe, and writing in the style of Joshua Seigal.

programme.title: Wow Thats Amazing
programme.desc: Owain and Tilly discover how to sleep beneath the stars from the comfort of your bed, feel the pressure of a blast-off battle, and find out that seeing double depends on your point of view!

programme.title: Our School
programme.desc: Its the start of term, and the girls are arriving from all over the world to study. New student Cherry says goodbye to her family in Shanghai, and Spanish student Valentina swaps Barcelona for Bristol.

programme.title: Go Get Arty
programme.desc: The Kwapongs serve up edible-looking 3D art, Nick Sharratt draws a super cool koala, and Harkiran Kalsi creates an amazing seaside sculpture!

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: Theres a festival vibe at the zoo with the arrival of two new Asiatic lions. Meanwhile, cute red panda cub Tashi gets a check-up.

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Emily from the Scottish Highlands is crazy about crochet, and her crafty creations are taking over the house and driving Mum and Dad mad. She desperately needs a space where she can crochet to her hearts content, store all her woolly wonders and hang out with mates.

programme.title: Absolute Genius: Monster Builds
programme.desc: Dick and Dom head underground to reveal the three tunnelling geniuses whose ideas revolutionised the way we dig below the earth. They put dynamite to the test, visit the worlds largest boring drill, and build their own tunnelling robot.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: King George III goes from a young unpopular king to a much-loved figure some 60 years later, and we learn a bit about his court life along the way. Meanwhile, across the world we hear about some of the words we have got from India.

programme.title: Our Black History Heroes
programme.desc: Bobby tells the life story of one of the greatest basketball players and cultural influencers of all time, Michael Jordan.

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: Totally bonkers brothers Danny and Mick get into all sorts of cringe-tastic disasters while working together at the Pottsfield Leisure Centre.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Henny Feathers is an egg-centric farmer whose chickens arent laying eggs. Armed with costumes, mini-cameras and a Chicken Translator, Andy and the Band investigate.

programme.title: Gladiators: Epic Pranks
programme.desc: Nitro pranks Apollo again, this time he thinks he is filming for a Gladiator video game set in ancient Greece. The other Gladiators have sneaky fun backstage at the Sheffield Arena.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Shellington and the Octonauts try to track an unusual creature: a jellyfish that can transform from old to young repeatedly - and live forever!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When Cosima finally finds a quiet place to read her book, she realises peace and quiet arent all theyre made out to be. Wheres Big Lizard when she needs him?

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Moments after Penfold lands a date with Scarlett Johamster, Danger Mouse and the Professor pounce with conflicting advice on how to woo his world-famous love interest.

programme.title: Danger Mouse

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Ammas vegetable patch with a comical face, so they take it under their wing, naming it Nosey. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the creche, but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his nose falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky finds a party invitation and shows it to Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po. The invitation takes flight and the Teletubbies follow it to find a Tiddlytubbies party.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato and Carrot use chopsticks to stop Evil Pea in her evil balloon.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its the magical wish granter Mango, ready to make all the cast wishes come true.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Its a lovely sunny day, but Tee wants to stay inside. Mo tries to persuade him to come out and play by showing him videos of some of the outside fun theyve had.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sulas cousin Nicky is visiting, something Bing is a little unsure about. Sula and Bing start making rippy pictures, and while Sula is looking for some purple paper Bing shows Nicky how to voosh the blue speedy car down the slide. However, Nicky vooshes too, falling and breaking his glasses! Sula is furious and Bing is forlorn. Amma soothes Bing while Nicky shows him that he can click his glasses back together again.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Welcome to Purples mixing factory, where he mixes two colours to create a new colour. In this musical episode, the Colourblocks learn that mixing red and yellow makes orange, whilst adding black and white helps to make darker and lighter colours.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is having a bad hair day. Can the Squirrels help him at all?

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When Mole was young he wanted to be a stunt mole. Can Duggee and the squirrels help make his dreams come true?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum wont let Bingo have pavlova, so the kids find a way by playing a cheeky game of Cafe in the kitchen. But Dad the chef sets up a competing shop that only serves edamame beans.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum bans the girls from saying the word `dunny because its not a word the Queen of England would use, but the kids try and trick her into saying it anyway.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: In order to help protect a sandcastle that he and Tala built, Glitch uses a giant vacuum to suck up the sand from the Academys beach, exposing the illusive ghost crabs to the hungry seagulls up above.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the Tiny Terror
programme.desc: Peters plans to raid Mr McGregors garden are thwarted when he discovers the Shrew has got there first. Its down to the rabbits to find a way to get their garden back.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above and Beyond
programme.desc: The Octonauts expand their exploration beyond the sea - and onto land. With new rides and new friends, they are prepared to protect any habitats and animals at risk on land or under the water.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Nine finds new ways to add numbers as he puts on a magic show for the Numberblobs.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Somehow, P, O and P have popped Is dot, and she is not very happy. Can O and friends find it again before I loses her cool, or will things go from bad to worse?

programme.title: Nick Copes Popcast
programme.desc: Its curry night and Nick writes a song to help him remember to buy lots of healthy ingredients, but will he remember to buy Normans dog treats?

programme.title: Justins House
programme.desc: Justin Fletcher entertains a live audience of children with singing, dancing and comedy chaos. Justin, Robert and Little Monster prepare for a special visit from the king, but will Justins House be fun enough to get the royal seal of approval?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up, Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Yakka Dee! celebrates children communicating - because talking fills you up with whizz, pop, bang! Dee encourages a friend to say boat and theres a whirlwind word adventure. There are lots of different boats: a boat thats big, a boat thats small, and even a boat you can stick on the wall.

programme.title: Lu and the Bally Bunch
programme.desc: Lu has fun playing with Elodies cousin, leaving Elodie feeling left out.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a couple rehearsing a ballroom dance, accompanied by a piano player. He starts off playing slowly and speeds up towards the end of the dance. The Twirlywoos watch this with interest before they investigate the piano.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble is having trouble finding his trampoline in the garden, whilst Justin and his friends have lots of fun at an indoor adventure park.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Po makes lots of silly, funny sounds with the levers and buttons in Home Dome and then the Tubby Phone rings for a silly tubby phone dance.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome babies Ferne, Tobias, Betsy, Leo, Noah, Holly and their grown-ups to. Inside everyones bags in are plastic bottles which are explored through discovery, play, song and story.

programme.title: Maddie and Triggs
programme.desc: Mum and Dad are heading out, which means Maddie and Triggs get to spend the evening with Uncle George. Let us just hope they save enough energy for tidying up.

programme.title: Dylans Playtime Adventures
programme.desc: Dylan the astronaut wants to walk on the moon, but when a shooting star gets pulled into a black hole the expedition turns into a rescue mission.

programme.title: Kiri and Lou
programme.desc: Lou has a special drumming tree, but when he finds Dalvanius playing it, he gets upset. Lou realises hes not such a good sharer.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger the Tricarrotops explores the world of the crunchiest era, going on adventures throughout the colourful Vegesaur Valley.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The kids put together a horsey wedding to distract Socks when she refuses to let go of Blueys favourite toy, with dad and Uncle Stripe acting as the horses.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Norrie admits that she cant ride her new bike because she finds it too difficult. So Duggee gives her some encouragement and lets her know that there are skills that he is still yet to master too, like skateboarding.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Catchers land on a planet where the inhabitants all look like soap bars, who like to play tug-of-war with water sponges.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its the magical Pineapple attempting to perform a very difficult magic trick with the help of Kiwi.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Its Valentines Day and Harriet is showing the class how to make cards for their best friends. Timmy volunteers to be postman, but in his enthusiasm he manages to lose everything from his mailbag and Ruffy has to help sniff out the missing cards.

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Ted has big plans for his sister Sophias birthday. He organises a family tea party and begins by making delicious cupcakes. He also plans a scavenger hunt in the garden as a surprise.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Mollys Saint Lucian Jerk Sea Bass
programme.desc: Molly brings the flavours of the Caribbean to her home by cooking up a Saint Lucian-themed meal for her friends. She makes a feast of jerk sea bass, spiced potato wedges and a tangy avocado and pineapple salsa. Molly loves cooking and has learnt to make this flavourful feast from her dad, who is originally from St Lucia. Her friends taste some raw spring onions and tell us what they think.

programme.title: Ferne and Rorys Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Aness wants to find out about brilliant bats. Chantelle is in London to meet Sophie for a night-time adventure as bat detectives, while Rory and his son Sandy are at a country park looking for bat clues.

programme.title: Whats in Your Bag?
programme.desc: Raymond, who is a poet and deaf, explains how his heroic hearing aid chargers keep his hearing aids working so that he can hear more clearly.

programme.title: Time for School
programme.desc: Solomon and his friends are practising letters with Miss Gerrard. Outside, the children are going to the climbing wall area, and Mrs Collins has a challenge for them. Later, Solomon and Lusungu get arty and make their very own tie-dye t-shirts to wear, with help from Mrs Farrell.

programme.title: Graces Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace shows off three amazing machines that all help to build things. Grace drives a backhoe loader and gets to dig a hole, shows off an incredible bridge builder and then fills a hole using a concrete mixer truck.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say milk and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. Theres white milk, pink milk, baby milk and banana milk. We snuggle up for bedtime milk and even enjoy some mighty milk and monster milk! The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way and everyone has a boogie when Dees friend finally succeeds in saying todays word!

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Welcome to the fabulous, fun fruit factory, where Threes super fruit-sorting machines arent giving her any fruit. Find out how to split numbers into smaller numbers with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Its pandemonium at the Alphablocks animal sing-song. S has a special surprise in store. This episode has fun with the words cat, dog, cod, tag, jog, jig, mop, moo, moon, spoon and zoom.

programme.title: Wonderblocks
programme.desc: Cows dinner is stuck in the hayloft! Can Stop and Go help her reach her meal?

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Red and Yellow sort different coloured objects onboard the Sorting Express. Learn to spot the difference between colours and shades with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: As Roly makes his usual noise in the Clubhouse, Duggee and the Squirrels reminisce about how completely different Roly was when he first arrived. Hiding behind his dad, Roly wasnt loud at all but impossibly quiet. As Duggee shows Roly around the Clubhouse, he squeals, hides and hangs off his dad, and just seems altogether too shy to fit in. Duggee has a great idea to introduce Roly to Norrie, thinking a friend will help him to settle in.

programme.title: Yukee
programme.desc: Yukee and TapTap spend the night in a tent and are surprised to meet some beautiful, musical fireflies!

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friend meet some amazing reptiles and make a snake sock puppet. Mr Tumble has his own animal fun when five speckled frogs come to visit.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies cant get enough of the Tubby Custard Ride so they ask to go on it again and again! In Tummy Tales, children play on a slide again and again.

programme.title: Andys Safari Adventures
programme.desc: When clouds of sand block the underwater cameras back at Safari World, Jen is unable to show Mr Hammond the footage of their male pufferfish building its nest. To the rescue comes Andy, who jets off in his safari-mobile to the coral reefs of Japan to find another male pufferfish building a nest so he can re-record the action on his gizmo.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Its the day of Jesss `bring a pet birthday party. Gramps is one of the first to arrive with Muckypups and Thor, two pugs hes dogsitting for the day, and AJ and Anaya have also brought their pets, a gecko called Leo and three fish, Dipper, Dapper and Dopper. Simon and Waffle put on a show for their excited guests, performing the amazing tricks Waffle has mastered. Next to arrive is Mr. Meagre and his talking parrot, Pickles.

programme.title: Topsy and Tim
programme.desc: A hole in the roof means rain water is leaking in through the ceiling of Topsy and Tims bedroom, making Topsys top bunk and Little Moon Bunny wet. Tim helps Dad mend the leak with some help from Kerrys dad, Carson.

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: Raa Raa cant get rid of his hiccups. His friends try to help him.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Game Catchers land on the Bubble Planet, where they learn the game Blow the Ball. But they will have to work together after Nina and Boxy become captured by a bubble!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Kwazii and Dashi become entangled in a strange deep-sea creature - a siphonophore. When a geyser blasts it toward the surface, the Octonauts must stop its ascent before it bursts.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the Big Move
programme.desc: When Lilys father decides to move the family out of the Lake District, Peter comes up with a clever but dangerous plan to change Dr Bobtails mind.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its a very windy day and the Squirrels want to play outside. Duggee knows what to do, hes flying his kite. The Squirrels make their own kites to fly.

programme.title: Vida the Vet
programme.desc: When Juno shows up too early to get her cast removed, she has to wait around while Vida finishes up her other appointments. But getting Juno to be a patient patient is not easy.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato and Evil Pea fall inside a sofa and meet a new friend called Raisin.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: After a storm passes overhead, many creatures turn up in surprising places and need Cosima and Big Lizards help. But try as they might, the friends cant find poor Rex.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Mojo and Bo need to get Felix, Dot and Nans giant pie across the lake at once. But Felix wants the pie, and Dot wants Felix. It will take some creative puzzle-solving!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum wont let Bingo have pavlova, so the kids find a way by playing a cheeky game of Cafe in the kitchen. But Dad the chef sets up a competing shop that only serves edamame beans.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: A sales rep visits. Despite Pancakes doubts, he convinces the Piris to buy extra flippers. The penguins discover that their purchases are duds but find a clever new use for them.

programme.title: Dodges Pup School
programme.desc: Miss Collie brings her pet stick insect, Woody, to class, but halfway through the day, Woody mysteriously vanishes! Dodge, Woofer, and Jazz spring into action, convinced a pup has taken him, and launch an investigation to track down the culprit. Just as Dodge thinks hes cracked the case, they discover Woody was in his tank all along, showing off some surprising skills!

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: An old friend of Gramps, Mr Willow, brings along his two dogs to play with Waffle. Evie feels a bit left out until Waffle reassures her. The two new dogs escape into Mrs Hobbss garden, so Waffle has to save the day.

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Whilst waiting for Bernadette on a date, Bernie is washed out to sea on a piece of driftwood. Oona hastily seeks Marvins help, knowing time is of the essence.

programme.title: JoJo and Gran Gran
programme.sub-title: - Autumn:Its Time to Be Nature Detectives
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran are off to join Cynthia and the Nature Club at the park looking for animals that are hard to spot. JoJo has packed her Nature Tick Book and her magnifying glass. But where is Panda? And why are some creatures really tricky to find? Its time for a Gran Gran plan to help the Nature Club find all of the creatures on their lists, especially the hard-to-spot woodpecker. Can JoJo also help Gran Gran find her missing scarf with the magnifying glass?

programme.desc: After discovering two paper crowns, Pepi Nana and Little Nana decide to be the Big Princess and the Little Princess. In Storyland the Little Princess goes to visit the Big Princess in her Big Castle, where she enjoys the biggest tea she has ever had.

programme.desc: Doug and Carrie both have very specific ideas on how to spend their vacation together. Doug wants to rent an RV, while Carrie prefers a visit to Paris. So they flip a coin.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie is turned on by Dougs imitation of his new Hispanic co-worker, Rico. He later becomes jealous of his own Rico imitation! Arthur tries to chronicle his own life story.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Raymond is horrified when he thinks his `cookie nemesis flirted with him.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra gets annoyed with Ray when he seems pleased that shes picked one of her attractive friends to replace her if she dies.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra gives a bridal shower for Amy, but her good intentions get sidetracked by Maries overzealous participation.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles new girlfriend pushes him and Frasier into competition for a coveted position in their wine club.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier and Roz discover they have a lot in common when they are forced to bunk together at a convention.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasiers agent Bebe becomes his unlikely co-host during a temporary stint on a TV talk show.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: To Thine Old Self Be True
programme.desc: Frasier tries to plan Donnys stag party and ends up handcuffed to a stripper, embarrassing himself in front of Regan. Meanwhile, Niles discovers that Maris has ballooned to obesity pining for him.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Damico is President of Moes Southwest Grill, one of the fastest growing restaurant chains in the world, which has 10,000 employees serving over 150,000 guests every day. Here, he goes undercover in his company.

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Channel 4s midday news summary.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A desert storm blows in weather woes for two guesthouse owners in Spain. In Greece two dive instructors try to end their season on a high. And will a vineyard in Italy bear fruit?

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The boys head to Wokingham in Berkshire to meet professional gardener Mark, whose barns are brimful of bikes, bric-a-brac and baggage.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Ade Adepitan in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Corfu holds a special place in Lisa and Waynes hearts, as its where they just got married. Can Laura Hamilton find them the perfect holiday home in Kassiopi for their £130k?

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Its all hands on deck as Tracey and Budo finish their kitchen roof, and Louise and Paul get underpinning in France, while Neil gets some Spanish artisan inspiration.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The new run continues at Chriss Dale2Swale Glamping in Richmond, North Yorkshire, where off-grid really does mean off the electricity grid, which is quite a worry for some of the BandBers.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Glasgow, Lydia hopes that her classic grub and rave-themed evening will have her guests in a trance.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sallys after a family holiday home in Manilva, Spain for £190k. Craig Rowe shows her a quirky townhouse and a place with a tantalising terrace, but did one impress her in La Duquesa?

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: We catch up with Becky and Adam in Essex, whose dreamy doer-upper has changed a lot since 2019, and Kinga and Dave, who loved and lost out in Leeds before finding the one in 2021.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Armed with £100k and nothing but determination and forest timber, Marcus and Abi defy convention by building an off-grid home with no detailed plans in 20 acres of Pembrokeshire woodland.

programme.title: Britains Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Can Josh seal a £15m deal in Sandbanks and bag his client a new place? George Washingtons ancestral home goes up for sale. And a £3m Essex home needs selling, fast! (S3 Ep8)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: In an egg-ception Bake Off first, its Meringue Week, and the bakers whisk up tarts, souffles and ice cream cake. Who can keep their cool and whose souffle will be in disarray?

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Ramsey tackles spoiled food, fake fish and a small customer base when he visits Sante La Brea in the heart of Hollywood.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz are taking on a neglected 1988 Fiat Uno Turbo. The car belongs to former car salesman Gerry, who has been suffering from ill health.

programme.title: Minimum
programme.desc: Rumana Mollas poignant drama about a newly-wed woman whos held captive by her mother-in-law. But a blossoming friendship with her French tutor saves her.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: In south Wales, Prego host first, as Toni and Andrea aim to provide a fully authentic Italian experience. Second to host are Dan and Rhys from La Cocina Tapas, and Martine and Lana from the Lamb and Flag host the final night.

programme.title: 99 Songs
programme.desc: A tortured but passionate singer-songwriter is challenged to compose 100 songs before he can marry the girl he loves.

programme.title: Mr Joe B. Carvalho
programme.desc: A small time detective is hired to bring back the daughter of a businessman who has run away from home with the house chef.

programme.title: Shriman Shrimati
programme.desc: The story of a couple who travel from house to house to help people with their family problems.

programme.title: Ishq Vishk
programme.desc: It is about Rajiv and Payal who are friends since childhood. While Payal is in love with Rajiv, it takes him a bit longer to return her feelings.

programme.title: De Dana Dan
programme.desc: Singapore-based Nitin Bankars education was paid for by his employer, Kuljeet Kaur, and he, after the passing of his father, works as an unpaid maid-chauffeur for her until such time he pays off whatever she had spent.

programme.title: Dostana
programme.desc: Two straight guys pretend to be a gay couple to secure a posh Miami apartment, but both of them fall for their gorgeous room-mate Neha.

programme.title: Anwar
programme.desc: Anwar unknowingly take part in the murder and suicide of two lovers, and escapes to find solitude, but is soon arrested for terrorism under false suspicions.

programme.title: The Great Indian Butterfly
programme.desc: A young couple named Krish and Meera are confused and frustrated at the corporate rat race unfolding around them and, as an antidote, they they go in search of a legendary magical insect.

programme.sub-title: In the Heat of the Day
programme.desc: Carter is arrested by police when they mistake him for a mugger; Paul tries to prove that hes not racist after a Latino City Councilman misinterprets something he says.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Blind Dates
programme.desc: Joey and Phoebe conspire to arrange awful dates for both Rachel and Ross, hoping that appreciation of their former relationship will push them back together. Meanwhile, the ovulating Monica wants to get intimate with Chandler.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Boob Job
programme.desc: Monica secretly asks Joey for a loan because she and Chandler are strapped for cash, Phoebe invites her boyfriend to move in with her, and Rachels apartment baby-proofing drives Joey crazy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Cruise TV with LoveitBookit
programme.desc: A definitive one-stop shop for all things cruise, bringing you the hottest destinations and the latest deals to ensure that your next cruise ship holiday is your greatest one yet.

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: When Mike finds out his grandson Boyd is no longer registered at school as a Baxter, Kristen tells him Ryan is recommitted to them and wants their son to start using his last name.

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: For the Buffalo Bill Day Sale-abration, the Outdoor Man puts on a classic entertainment skit based on a Wild West Show.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra have wildly differing opinions of how to react to the news that Ally has been bullying another child on the school bus.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Ray agrees to go back to church, he soon discovers why Frank is happy to go every week.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Robert is injured in the line of duty, Ray realises that he is partly, although unwittingly, responsible. Rays bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired, until he grudgingly agrees to Debras demand to tell Robert how much he cares for him.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Debra discovers that Ray taped over their wedding video with the SuperBowl, he must go to extreme lengths to make it up to her.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: The mayors daughter disrupts a rally in Central Park and the gang tries to reunite Paul with Claudia.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike tries to make the children of New York believe in Santa Claus after the mayor tells them there isnt one.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: A New Years celebration at the mayors mansion gets out of control, causing embarrassing results for Mike and Nikki.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike has trouble concentrating on work when he learns he may have cancer, and the staffers are terrorised by a chair-snatching bureaucrat.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe finds out that her picture of her father, whom she has never known, is just a generic photograph that comes with the picture frame. Elsewhere, after Ross makes Monicas heater malfunction, her Christmas party guests swelter in the middle of winter.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey gets a great acting opportunity on `Days of our Lives, Rachel dates a guy called Russ who is amazingly similar to Ross, and Monica renews her relationship with `Fun Bobby, but finds out Bobby is only fun when he is drinking.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Lesbian Wedding
programme.desc: Rachels free-spirited mother visits and reveals that she wants to end her marriage and experiment sexually. Meanwhile, Carol and Susan prepare for their wedding, with some help from an uncomfortable Ross.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl
programme.desc: Joey starts dating a fan who is gorgeous, but soon discovers that shes also quite mad. Meanwhile, Ross is reminded how much he misses Marcel his old pet monkey, and travels to San Diego Zoo to find out what has happened to him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl
programme.desc: Ross finally spends some time with Marcel after many false starts, and Chandler is delighted to get a date with the sexy Susie, who he hasnt seen since fourth grade. However, she gets her revenge for youthful humiliation by leaving him in the loo, naked but for a pair of her knickers.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Prom Video
programme.desc: When Monicas parents clear out her old room to install a gym, they unearth an old video of her and Rachels first prom night. Its obvious from this that Ross is in love with Rachel and, having told him it will never happen, Rachel changes her mind. Elsewhere, Joey gives Chandler a hideous bracelet as a token of his friendship and is mortally offended to hear Chandler saying how terrible it is.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross and Rachel ... You Know
programme.desc: Among the guests at Monicas party is a handsome and sophisticated doctor, but the only problem is that hes old enough to be her father. Meanwhile, Joey buys a big screen TV and two reclining leather armchairs with the money from his `Days of Our Lives contract.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Moves Out
programme.desc: Everyone at Monicas dads birthday party finds it amusing that their middle-aged friend, eye-doctor Richard Burke, is dating a woman in her 20s - until Monicas parents learn that it is their daughter. Meanwhile, Chandler and Joey row over a dirty spoon. Is the apartment still big enough for both of them?

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Eddie Moves In
programme.desc: With Joey in his new apartment, Chandler gets a troublesome new flatmate, Eddie. Meanwhile, Phoebe makes a video for `Smelly Cat, and Ross and Monica find it nearly impossible to live together.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Dr Ramoray Dies
programme.desc: Joeys remarks to a fan magazine could cause him to lose his job playing Dr Ramoray on a daytime television drama, and Chandlers new flatmate Eddie becomes too annoying to cope with.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Eddie Wont Go
programme.desc: Chandler wants his annoying new roommate to move out, Joey is forced to face some exorbitant bills, and the girls learn from a book about personal empowerment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Old Yeller Dies
programme.desc: Monicas new boyfriend impresses Chandler and Joey, Phoebe finds out what she missed as a child, and Rachel resents the fact that Ross is planning the rest of their lives together.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica is broke and decides to gamble on the stock market, and Chandler and Ross run into a couple of bullies in Central Park. Meanwhile, Rachel and Joey help Phoebe locate her father, but a vicious dog prevents Phoebe from finally meeting him. After accidentally injuring the dog with her car, Phoebe gets to know her fathers second wife whom she never knew about, and another long-lost family member.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica decides to hold a surprise birthday for Rachel, but everything goes wrong when Rachels estranged parents turn up unexpectedly. The party then splits into two factions: a dreary gathering in Monicas apartment, and a college-style drunken party at Chandler and Joeys flat.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Chicken Pox
programme.desc: Phoebes submariner boyfriend visits New York on leave from the Navy. Unfortunately, Phoebe catches chicken pox at baby Bens first birthday party. Meanwhile, when Monica realises that Richard has no real neuroses, she worries that she is too strange for him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Barry and Mindys Wedding
programme.desc: When Rachel serves as a bridesmaid at the wedding of her ex-fiance Barry and her friend Mindy, she relives the nightmare of her own failed wedding day. Meanwhile, Chandler becomes enamoured with a woman he meets on the internet, but is surprised when he finally meets her.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Brad and Barney kickstart this leg of their tour with a bang - in honour of the famous Swede, Alfred Nobel. They then hit the ice and go head to head in a curling competition alongside the Swedish Womens Team in Stockholm. Barney treats his dad to an infamous fishy delicacy for breakfast, then takes him paintballing - with a Western twist! Before leaving the country, Barney treats ABBA mega fan Brad to the ultimate musical surprise.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: In the final leg of Brad and Barneys epic journey, the pair experience a bitterly cold Norway. The boys head to Lillehammer and try out the Olympic bobsleigh track before heading further north to the Arctic Circle and the worlds most northerly surfing location.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr once again oversees the disputes and deliberations on the topical events that set the nations chins wagging as Jon and Sean are joined by guests Hannibal Buress, Sam Buttery, Stephen Mangan and Katherine Ryan.

programme.title: Iain Stirlings Roast The Internet
programme.sub-title: Maisie Adam, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Vogue Williams
programme.desc: ...Internet. Iain is joined by Maisie Adam, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Vogue Williams to rip into embarrassing TikToks, confusing challenges and painfully awkward posts. (S1, E07)

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra have wildly differing opinions of how to react to the news that Ally has been bullying another child on the school bus.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Ray agrees to go back to church, he soon discovers why Frank is happy to go every week.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Robert is injured in the line of duty, Ray realises that he is partly, although unwittingly, responsible. Rays bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired, until he grudgingly agrees to Debras demand to tell Robert how much he cares for him.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Debra discovers that Ray taped over their wedding video with the SuperBowl, he must go to extreme lengths to make it up to her.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: The mayors daughter disrupts a rally in Central Park and the gang tries to reunite Paul with Claudia.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike tries to make the children of New York believe in Santa Claus after the mayor tells them there isnt one.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: A New Years celebration at the mayors mansion gets out of control, causing embarrassing results for Mike and Nikki.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike has trouble concentrating on work when he learns he may have cancer, and the staffers are terrorised by a chair-snatching bureaucrat.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe finds out that her picture of her father, whom she has never known, is just a generic photograph that comes with the picture frame. Elsewhere, after Ross makes Monicas heater malfunction, her Christmas party guests swelter in the middle of winter.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey gets a great acting opportunity on `Days of our Lives, Rachel dates a guy called Russ who is amazingly similar to Ross, and Monica renews her relationship with `Fun Bobby, but finds out Bobby is only fun when he is drinking.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Lesbian Wedding
programme.desc: Rachels free-spirited mother visits and reveals that she wants to end her marriage and experiment sexually. Meanwhile, Carol and Susan prepare for their wedding, with some help from an uncomfortable Ross.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl
programme.desc: Joey starts dating a fan who is gorgeous, but soon discovers that shes also quite mad. Meanwhile, Ross is reminded how much he misses Marcel his old pet monkey, and travels to San Diego Zoo to find out what has happened to him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl
programme.desc: Ross finally spends some time with Marcel after many false starts, and Chandler is delighted to get a date with the sexy Susie, who he hasnt seen since fourth grade. However, she gets her revenge for youthful humiliation by leaving him in the loo, naked but for a pair of her knickers.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Prom Video
programme.desc: When Monicas parents clear out her old room to install a gym, they unearth an old video of her and Rachels first prom night. Its obvious from this that Ross is in love with Rachel and, having told him it will never happen, Rachel changes her mind. Elsewhere, Joey gives Chandler a hideous bracelet as a token of his friendship and is mortally offended to hear Chandler saying how terrible it is.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross and Rachel ... You Know
programme.desc: Among the guests at Monicas party is a handsome and sophisticated doctor, but the only problem is that hes old enough to be her father. Meanwhile, Joey buys a big screen TV and two reclining leather armchairs with the money from his `Days of Our Lives contract.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Moves Out
programme.desc: Everyone at Monicas dads birthday party finds it amusing that their middle-aged friend, eye-doctor Richard Burke, is dating a woman in her 20s - until Monicas parents learn that it is their daughter. Meanwhile, Chandler and Joey row over a dirty spoon. Is the apartment still big enough for both of them?

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Eddie Moves In
programme.desc: With Joey in his new apartment, Chandler gets a troublesome new flatmate, Eddie. Meanwhile, Phoebe makes a video for `Smelly Cat, and Ross and Monica find it nearly impossible to live together.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Dr Ramoray Dies
programme.desc: Joeys remarks to a fan magazine could cause him to lose his job playing Dr Ramoray on a daytime television drama, and Chandlers new flatmate Eddie becomes too annoying to cope with.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Eddie Wont Go
programme.desc: Chandler wants his annoying new roommate to move out, Joey is forced to face some exorbitant bills, and the girls learn from a book about personal empowerment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Old Yeller Dies
programme.desc: Monicas new boyfriend impresses Chandler and Joey, Phoebe finds out what she missed as a child, and Rachel resents the fact that Ross is planning the rest of their lives together.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica is broke and decides to gamble on the stock market, and Chandler and Ross run into a couple of bullies in Central Park. Meanwhile, Rachel and Joey help Phoebe locate her father, but a vicious dog prevents Phoebe from finally meeting him. After accidentally injuring the dog with her car, Phoebe gets to know her fathers second wife whom she never knew about, and another long-lost family member.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica decides to hold a surprise birthday for Rachel, but everything goes wrong when Rachels estranged parents turn up unexpectedly. The party then splits into two factions: a dreary gathering in Monicas apartment, and a college-style drunken party at Chandler and Joeys flat.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Chicken Pox
programme.desc: Phoebes submariner boyfriend visits New York on leave from the Navy. Unfortunately, Phoebe catches chicken pox at baby Bens first birthday party. Meanwhile, when Monica realises that Richard has no real neuroses, she worries that she is too strange for him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Barry and Mindys Wedding
programme.desc: When Rachel serves as a bridesmaid at the wedding of her ex-fiance Barry and her friend Mindy, she relives the nightmare of her own failed wedding day. Meanwhile, Chandler becomes enamoured with a woman he meets on the internet, but is surprised when he finally meets her.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Brad and Barney kickstart this leg of their tour with a bang - in honour of the famous Swede, Alfred Nobel. They then hit the ice and go head to head in a curling competition alongside the Swedish Womens Team in Stockholm. Barney treats his dad to an infamous fishy delicacy for breakfast, then takes him paintballing - with a Western twist! Before leaving the country, Barney treats ABBA mega fan Brad to the ultimate musical surprise.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: In the final leg of Brad and Barneys epic journey, the pair experience a bitterly cold Norway. The boys head to Lillehammer and try out the Olympic bobsleigh track before heading further north to the Arctic Circle and the worlds most northerly surfing location.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr once again oversees the disputes and deliberations on the topical events that set the nations chins wagging as Jon and Sean are joined by guests Hannibal Buress, Sam Buttery, Stephen Mangan and Katherine Ryan.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Long Gone Heroes
programme.desc: Gunner is a special forces soldier who returns to the field of battle to save his kidnapped niece in South America. He and his team soon discover that her disappearance is part of a corrupt private operation that hits way too close to home.

programme.title: One Shot
programme.desc: To prevent a terrorist attack on U.S. soil, a Navy SEAL team leader and a CIA analyst must retrieve a detainee from a secret compound while fending off an assault by insurgents.

programme.title: William Tell
programme.desc: In 14th Century Switzerland, a once peaceful hunter leads his people in rebellion after his family and country are threatened by a tyrannical Austrian King. As the Holy Roman Empire crumbles, the quiet lives of the Swiss peasants are upended.

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: In the late 21st century, a factory worker visits a company that implants fake memories. However, after his procedure he struggles to tell real and fabricated thoughts apart.

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Beginning in ancient China, the ruthless Emperor Han will stop at nothing to gain control of the region. Many years on, in the 1940s, Hans tomb is discovered, and Rick OConnell and his wife Evelyn get drawn into a plot to resurrect the emperor and restore him to power.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
programme.desc: Professor Henry Jones is given a coded message during the Cold War which leads him to Peru in search of a legendary skull. Jones needs to deliver the skull to its rightful place, but Soviet agents who are trailing Jones have other plans which will endanger the West if the artefact falls into their hands.

programme.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace
programme.desc: World leaders want Superman to intervene in the arms race, but he is caught in a dilemma - having vowed never to interfere in history. He eventually agrees to destroy all nuclear weapons, but then comes face to face with the android Protean Man, Lex Luthors latest evil creation. Luthor wants to stoke up the arms race, and sees the android - made from Kryptonite - as the only way to stop Superman.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after a five-year absence to find Lex Luthor ready to take over the world, and Lois Lane shacked up with a new man and a kid. The people have lost faith in their former saviour. Can Superman save their lives and regain their trust?

programme.title: Kong: Skull Island
programme.desc: Scientists, soldiers and adventurers encounter the mighty Kong and other monstrous creatures after travelling to an uncharted island in the Pacific Ocean.

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Oscar-winning World War II tale combining the story of an unusual rescue mission with an overwhelmingly powerful re-creation of the D-Day landings. A group of American soldiers are dispatched to locate one man among thousands, a US private whose three brothers have all been killed in action. The powers that be want to send him home to his family.

programme.title: Blood for Dust
programme.desc: Travelling salesman Cliff is drowning under the weight of providing for his family and finds himself on a dangerous path after a chance encounter with a colleague who has a dark past. Desperate to keep his fragile home life intact, Cliff agrees to partner with Ricky and run cocaine across Montana.

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: The heir to a newspaper fortune joins forces with a resourceful company employee to try to bring a powerful Los Angeles crime lord to justice.

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: A feature-length spin-off from the TV series, the Thornberry family - led by natural history film-maker Colonel Radcliff Thornberry - head to deepest Africa. Once there, daughter Eliza - after meeting a shaman - can talk to the animals, a skill that stands her in good stead to foil a dastardly plot by poachers to kill a herd of elephants for their ivory.

programme.title: Piece by Piece
programme.desc: LEGO bricks tell the life story of singer/songwriter and record producer Pharrell Williams -- from his childhood in Virginia to his success in the music and fashion industry.

programme.title: Justice League Vs. Bizarro League
programme.desc: Superman, Batman and the rest of the Justice League team up with the Bizarro League to defeat Darkseid.

programme.title: The Inseparables
programme.desc: A runaway puppet with an overactive imagination and an abandoned stuffed animal in need of a friend meet in Central Park and join forces to try and find a home for the both of them.

programme.title: Dr. Seuss the Lorax
programme.desc: A young boy searches for a way to gain the affections of his dream-girl. In his quest he learns that in order to succeed he must uncover the story of the grumpy but nature-loving Lorax.

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild
programme.desc: The children and their bickering family are stranded on a desert island. Fortunately help is at hand from the Thornberry family, who are visiting the island to film a rare snow leopard. Once again, animal-understanding Eliza saves the day.

programme.title: Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs
programme.desc: Inventor Flint Lockwood dreams of discovering an idea that will change peoples lives forever, and after several misguided attempts he may just have done it. Flint has invented a machine that can turn water into delicious food, and, when his first demonstration accidentally sends the machine shooting into the clouds, cheeseburgers begin raining down from the sky.

programme.title: Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs 2
programme.desc: Discovering that his most-famous machine is now creating animal/vegetable hybrids, inventor Flint Lockwood and his friends venture forth to save the world from tacodiles, shrimpanzees and other creatures.

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: A fast-talking fish gains fame after taking credit for the accidental death of a shark mobster. While enjoying the popularity at first, his tall tale starts to unravel as others begin to suspect that he is not the Defender of the Reef after all, and when the sharks enemies get involved, his lies lead him into dangerous waters. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: Spoiled by their upbringing and with no idea of what wildlife is really like, Alex the lion, Marty the zebra and hypochondriac giraffe Melman swap New York Central Zoo for madcap Madagascar, on a journey to find their friend.

programme.title: The LEGO Movie 2: The Second Part
programme.desc: The citizens of Bricksburg face a dangerous new threat when LEGO DUPLO invaders from outer space start to wreck everything in their path. The battle to defeat the enemy and restore harmony to the LEGO universe takes Emmet, Lucy, Batman and the rest of their friends to faraway, unexplored worlds that test their courage and creativity.

programme.title: Bon Voyage Charlie Brown (And Dont Come Back)
programme.desc: The Peanuts gang spends two adventure-filled weeks in Europe as exchange students.

programme.title: Piece by Piece
programme.desc: LEGO bricks tell the life story of singer/songwriter and record producer Pharrell Williams -- from his childhood in Virginia to his success in the music and fashion industry.

programme.title: The Swan Princess: The Secret of the Castle
programme.desc: Princess Odette and Prince Dereks wedding anniversary celebrations are rudely interrupted by evil wizard Clavius, who once again wants to conquer the world. When Clavius kidnaps Queen Uberta, Odette and Derek must put a stop to his fiendish schemes.

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: Otis the cow is a wild-living party animal and just loves to dance until dawn, but then his dad is killed by coyotes, and Otis has to become the responsible leader of the rest of the all-singing, all-dancing farm animals.

programme.title: Buffalo Kids
programme.desc: Arriving in New York City in 1886, two orphaned Irish siblings embark on a wild cross-country journey aboard a transcontinental train. They make a new friend and encounter heroes and villains in their quest to find a new home.
